Data Analyst (Contractor) - job post Verkada 4 reviews San Mateo, CA 94401 $30 - $35 an hour -  Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $30 - $35 an hour Job Type Contract Who We Are Verkada is the largest cloud-based B2B physical security platform company in the world. Only Verkada offers seven product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, visitor management, mailroom management and intercoms — integrated with a single cloud-based software platform. Designed with simplicity and scalability in mind, Verkada gives organizations the real-time insight to know what could impact the safety and comfort of people throughout their physical environment, while empowering them to take immediate action to minimize security risks, workplace frustrations and costly inefficiencies. Founded in 2016 with more than $360M in funding raised to date, Verkada has expanded rapidly with 14 offices across three continents, 1,500+ full-time employees and 15,700+ customers across 70+ countries, including 43 companies in the Fortune 500. About the Role We are looking for a data analyst contractor to help streamline and produce weekly/month reports for the Strategic Finance team at Verkada. This is a great opportunity to get hands-on experiences supporting the Finance team of a fast growing, late stage startup. This is a wide-ranging role with many responsibilities to assist various team members, as well as the opportunity to lead small initiatives. This role requires someone with attention to detail, good organizational skills, good written and verbal communication skills, and good analytical skills.This is an in office contract role that is located in downtown San Mateo. In this role, you will: Export data from key financial and HRIS systems, transform and then produce reports that can facilitate critical analysis. Be responsible for gathering and cleaning datasets across multiple data sources.Learn to produce reports across key financial and HRIS systems. Assist in identifying process efficiencies across the work streams. Proactively identify insights and trends in the data that can help facilitate critical actionable decisions. Collaborate with teams across Verkada as needed to build scalable processes for faster reporting/insights. You Have: 2-3 years of data gathering, analysis and process improvement experience Bachelor's degree is strongly preferred Proficient with Microsoft office products Be self-motivated with a continuous improvement mindset. Immaculate attention to detail & sweat the details Employee Pay Disclosure At Verkada, we want to attract and retain the best employees, and compensate them in a way that appropriately and fairly values their individual contribution to the company. With that in mind, we carefully consider a number of factors to determine the appropriate starting pay for an employee/contractor, including their primary work location and an assessment of a candidate’s skills and experience, as well as market demands and internal parity. For this role, Verkada estimates an hourly rate that will fall in the range of approximately $30-$35 per hour. This estimate can vary based on the factors described above, so the actual starting hourly rate may be above or below this range. US Employee Benefits Verkada is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all employees and their families. Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to: Healthcare programs that can be tailored to meet the personal health and financial well-being needs - Premiums are 100% covered for the employee under most plans and 80% for family premiums Nationwide medical, vision and dental coverage Health Saving Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA) with tax saving options Expanded mental health support Paid parental leave policy & fertility benefits Time off to relax and recharge through our paid holidays, firmwide extended holidays, flexible PTO and personal sick time Professional development stipend Wellness/fitness benefits Healthy lunches and dinners provided daily Verkada Is An Equal Opportunity Employer As an equal opportunity employer, Verkada is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. Email Marketing Data Analyst - job post Xcel Agency San Francisco, CA 94114 Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Contract Company Description Xcel Agency is a leading digital marketing agency that specializes in helping global brands of all sizes increase their online visibility and reach their target audience. We help evolve and transform your data into best-in-class customer journeys that allow you to deepen customer relationships and drive revenue. With a robust team of experienced marketers, Xcel Agency offers a wide range of services to help businesses grow, including email marketing automation, social media marketing, search engine optimization, digital media services, and more. Our email marketing automation services help businesses create personalized and targeted campaigns that engage and convert customers, while its digital media services, including PPC advertising and social media advertising, drive targeted traffic to websites and generate leads and sales. With a focus on innovation, creativity, and results, Xcel Agency is the go-to partner for businesses looking to enhance their digital presence and drive growth. Job Description We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced data analyst to join our email marketing team. As an email marketing data analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing, interpreting, and making actionable insights from email campaign data to optimize email marketing strategy and drive business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement data-driven solutions to improve customer engagement, increase conversions, and enhance overall customer experience. What you’ll be doing: Develop and maintain data models and algorithms to drive insights into email campaign performance and customer behavior. Analyze email marketing data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities to optimize email campaigns and increase customer engagement and conversions. Develop and implement testing plans for email campaigns, including A/B testing, to optimize campaign performance and drive continuous improvement. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and engineering, to develop and implement data-driven solutions to improve email campaign performance and customer experience. Provide regular reports and dashboards to communicate campaign performance and insights to key stakeholders. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in email marketing, data analysis, and machine learning techniques to drive innovation and continuous improvement. Qualifications What we’re looking for: Agency experience preferred working with enterprise clients. Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. Master's or Ph.D. preferred. Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and modeling, with a focus on email marketing. Strong analytical skills and experience with data modeling, segmentation, and predictive analytics. Proficient in data analysis tools such as SQL, R, or Python. Experience with marketing automation tools such as Marketo, Eloqua, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud. Experience with A/B testing, experimental design, and statistical analysis. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders. Additional Information If you are a highly analytical and data-driven individual with a passion for email marketing and customer engagement, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity! We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to apply. This is a remote, contract position. Must reside in the United States.

We are searching for someone who wants to be a valued contributor and member of a talented and dynamic team of lawyers, paralegals and staff. The Contract Business Analyst is responsible for the requirements from elicitation to implementation ensuring the end solution meets the business needs. The Contract Business Analyst works closely with internal customers and IT teams to define, manage and document requirements for several concurrent initiatives. Responsibilities and Duties: Gathers, understands, analyzes, and documents the need of project stakeholders, formalizing the needs into a set of actionable business requirements. Analyzes, evaluates, and documents the current business processes and identifies future state, including business process modeling. Leads and completes vendor and software selection assessment, as needed. Schedules, plans, and leads requirement gathering and review meetings. Documents and communicates key decisions and actions items. Partners on development and implementation of standard business analysis tools and methodologies with BA team and PMO Manager. Monitors cross-functional deliverables ensuring timely completion of requirement analysis and solution design. Supports change management. Researches and reviews up-to-date business processes and new IT advancements to make systems more modern. Engages with stakeholders at all levels. Performs user acceptance testing. Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations to project sponsors and team members. Clearly communicates project issues and proposed mitigations to stakeholders and management. Collaborates with project managers and cross-functional teams throughout the project implementation cycle, as needed. Manages competing resources and priorities. Coordinates the day-to-day operational aspects of an initiative with PMO Manager. Applies and understands the full analysis process: Defining scope Identifying project benefits Developing business cases Requirements elicitation and management Process optimisation Business change management Requirements tractability to business benefits Input into testing Facilitating user acceptance testing Benefits realization Other duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: A Bachelor’s degree is required in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field, from an accredited college or university or an equivalent combination of an Associate degree with related job experience. Required Certifications: Industry recognized Business Analyst Certification (CAP or PBA or IIBA etc.) or Project Management Certification (PMP, SCM etc.) Five-seven years of experience working in a Technology Department is required, with a preference given for work experience in a multi-office legal environment. A minimum of five years of experience in leading projects as a business analyst. Familiar with software development methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills are required. Detail-oriented and organized. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads. Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language. Strong problem solving and decision-making skills. Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Office Suite with proficiency in Outlook are required. Salary is commensurate with years of experience and geographic location. Job Description: Business Analyst -- Custom LMS add-on application (GTACS) We have an in-house custom-developed software application named GTACS (Gilead Training Assignment and Curriculum Management System), which supplements Compliance Wire with functionality that it is lacking, using a data extract of all training item, curriculum and assignment data from Compliance Wire. We are currently finishing development and validation of Phase 1 functionality – the ability to compare an existing user or new hire's training curriculum assignments against other users, submit requests for addition or removal of multiple assignments to the Training Administration Group, and route those requests for approval, assignment to a specific Training Admin and tracking of processing status. Future phases of functionality are planned – ability to request assignments to User Groups (Learner Roles) in addition to direct curriculum assignments, bulk user assignment requests, manager periodic review of personnel's assignments, curriculum content management, periodic review of curriculum contents. Only high-level requirements have been documented for the future functionality (sometimes in the form of meeting notes and diagrams). We need a business analyst who can work with the business users to define detailed requirements and UI wireframes and translate those to the developer. UX/UI design skills are highly desired, because we can't guarantee the software developer will have a good sense of user experience and graphic design. GTACS is validated, so CSV experience is a must (not performing the validation, but writing testable requirements and reviewing test plans and scripts). Ability to take the initiative, manage one's own work to a chedule, independently interview stakeholders about their business process and requirements, and facilitate group meetings and status updates.
